programme.title: Panorama (False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal) (n°29)
programme.desc: «False Diagnosis: The ADHD Scandal»Do the thousands of people turning to private clinics for an assessment really have ADHD?

programme.title: Our Changing Planet S2 (2/2)
programme.desc: Six presenters meet the people fighting to rebalance earth's failing ecosystems.

programme.title: Mission déco S4 (7/8)
programme.desc: The remaining designers discover their penultimate challenge - a hair salon makeover.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.

programme.title: Hé, Oua-Oua (Norrie's First Day) S4 (1/40)
programme.desc: «Norrie's First Day»On her first day, Norrie enjoys the peace of the Clubhouse away from her 72 siblings!

programme.title: Hé, Oua-Oua (The Moving Badge) S4 (2/40)
programme.desc: «The Moving Badge»Snail is thrilled to be moving house, and the Squirrels help her.

programme.title: Supertato (Hiccup Havoc) S1 (n°19)
programme.desc: «Hiccup Havoc»Supertato uses his hiccups to save Tato Tower from Evil Pea's jam attack.

programme.title: Shaun le mouton (Rude Dude) S5 (n°4)
programme.desc: «Rude Dude»The farmer's rock 'n' roll idol is stranded at the farm after his limousine breaks down.

programme.title: Denis et Scratch : déchaînés ! (Sausage Lossage) S2 (7/52)
programme.desc: «Sausage Lossage»Walter takes over Butch Butcher's sausage-making business.

programme.title: Boy, Girl, etc. (Who Let the Weredogs Out) S2 (18/52)
programme.desc: «Who Let the Weredogs Out»Cheese tells Boy he has been the victim of a weredog staredown and may become a weredog.

programme.title: Sous les mers (Little Problems) S4 (3/13)
programme.desc: «Little Problems»Three baby Monumential turtles hatch, and they are the size of city blocks!

programme.title: Organisation super insolite (Slides and Ladders) S3 (3/33)
programme.desc: «Slides and Ladders»Oswald must learn everything he can about the Mobile Unit van.

programme.title: Game on Grandparents S1
programme.desc: Bonnie, Judith, Niamh and Sharon compete for the chance to make it to the Grand Final.

programme.title: One Zoo Three (Clever Communication) S3 (1/11)
programme.desc: «Clever Communication»The brothers discover many of the clever ways the zoo's animals communicate.

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Topical news magazine for children.

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Joel goes behind the scenes at the Harry Potter and the Cursed Child stage show to learn the secrets behind the magic. Meanwhile, in the studio Steven Mulhern shows us some magic of his own and goes head-to-head against Joel in a world record attempt.

programme.title: Deadly Predators (Wicked Weapons) S1 (5/7)
programme.desc: «Wicked Weapons»Steve meets a colossal squid and a silent owl assassin.

programme.title: Newsies: The Broadway Musical
programme.desc: A film of the high-energy Broadway musical inspired by the newsboys' strike of 1899 New York, with music by Alan Menken, lyrics by Jack Feldman and a book by Harvey Fierstein, starring Jeremy Jordan and Kara Lindsay.

programme.title: The Big Family Cooking Showdown S2
programme.desc: Four families must make a £10 meal for a family of four.

programme.title: Les grandes espérances
programme.desc: Vivid adaptation of the Dickens classic, starring John Mills.

programme.title: Les vestiges du jour
programme.desc: A dutiful butler represses his love for the housekeeper only to find his aristocratic master is a Nazi sympathiser.

programme.title: Flog It ! S11
programme.desc: The Flog It! team get frightened as Paul Martin heads to the spooky Dartmoor landscape and Caroline Hawley and Mark Stacey find strange things occurring in the queue. Paul Martin discovers a piece of music history, with a platinum disc signed by the boys of Coldplay, and we talk to an expert in America about a walking stick associated with General Tom Thumb.

programme.title: Dad's Army (Command Decision) S1 (3/6)
programme.desc: «Command Decision»Captain Mainwaring puts the defence of the realm before personal pride and nearly loses control of the platoon.

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust S1 (2/6)
programme.desc: Inside the homes and hidden lives of writers Rudyard Kipling and Vita Sackville-West.

programme.title: Pet Shop Boys at the BBC
programme.desc: A look back at one of British music's most enduring and significant partnerships of the past four decades, the Pet Shop Boys, with highlights from Neil Tennant and Chris Lowe's many appearances on the BBC that demonstrate their dedication to both style and substance. It's a journey that takes us from the early days of just two men and a synth right up to the fun and flamboyance of their modern live shows, via hit collaborations with Liza Minelli, Dusty Springfield and David Bowie - proving that Pet Shop Boys stand alongside the great pioneers of pop.

programme.title: Reel Stories (Pet Shop Boys)
programme.desc: «Pet Shop Boys»The Pet Shop Boys watch back the twists and turns of a career like no other.

programme.title: Later with Jools Holland S62
programme.desc: With Hozier, Arlo Parks, Lisa O'Neill, Thee Sacred Souls, Venbee and Jill Furmanovsky.

programme.title: Pet Shop Boys: Live in Hyde Park
programme.desc: Live coverage of the Pet Shop Boys' headline set at Radio 2 Live In Hyde Park. Neil Tennant and Chris Lowe are the most successful duo in UK music history. Having achieved 42 top 30 singles in the UK since 1985, there is no shortage of hits for them to choose from as they play their only UK gig of the year in front of more than 40,000 festivalgoers. Keep an eye out for a mystery guest artist.
